unsettled adjective
(WORRIED)
nervous and worried; unable to relax: Children tend to get unsettled if you continually change their routine.

unsettled adjective
(CHANGEABLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
tending to change suddenly; not having a regular pattern: Things are unsettled in the state’s political arena. The forecast is for unsettled weather, with more snow to come.
unsettled adjective
(ANXIOUS)
anxious and worried; unable to relax: She was feeling unsettled the entire morning before her interview.
